msContents.summary: Turkish grammar explained in Arabic, covering the imperative (al-ʼamr), negative imperative (al-nahī), simple past and past perfect (al-māḍī), present tense (muḍāriʿ al-misnad), and verbal nouns (ism al-fāʿil), before proceeding to the construction of simple sentences and additional suffixes..
